public class Exit
extends java.lang.Object
implements Land

Darren Watts date 11/11/07

Constructor Detail

Exit

public Exit(ExitType type,
            int nextCity,
            int destinationRow,
            int destinationCol,
            boolean isOpen)
Creates a new exit. Needs to know the type of exit and the destination city and location. Depending on the type of exit, the destination location may be ignored. The exit also needs to know if it's open.

Parameters:
type - ExitType : type of exit.
nextCity - int : next city
destinationRow - int : destination row in city
destinationCol - int : destination column in city
isOpen - boolean : whether or not the exit is open for use.

canEnter

public boolean canEnter()
Player can enter if the door is open, otherwise he can't. If the door is open, it will take the player to the next city.

Specified by:
canEnter in interface Land
Returns:
Boolean indicating whether or not the player can enter the object.

enter

public void enter(Player plr)
If the player can enter it will transport the player to the new location. It will treat the different types of Exits differently.

Specified by:
enter in interface Land
Parameters:
plr - The player entering the exit.
